org.vaadin.appfoundation.authorization
Interface PermissionManager

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPermissionManager, JPAPermissionManager, MemoryPermissionManager
public interface PermissionManager
extends java.io.Serializable

This interface defines a set of methods for permission managers, which are used by the application foundation's authorization module. Each implementation of the different permission managers needs to implement this interface.

Author:
Kim

Method Detail

allow

void allow(Role role,
           java.lang.String action,
           Resource resource)
Grants the given role the permission to perform the given action for the given resource.

Parameters:
role - The role which is being assigned the permission
action - The identifier for the action
resource - The resource to which the permission applies
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null

allowAll

void allowAll(Role role,
              Resource resource)

Grants the given role to perform any action for the given resource.

Example:
allowAll(role, resource);
allow(anotherRole, "write", resource);

hasAccess(role, "read", resource) - returns true
hasAccess(role, "close", resource) - returns true
hasAccess(role, "write", resource) - returns true
deny(role, "write", resource);
hasAccess(role, "write", resource) - returns false

Parameters:
role - The role which is being assigned the permission
resource - The resource to which the permission applies
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null

deny

void deny(Role role,
          java.lang.String action,
          Resource resource)
Denies the given role the permission to perform the given action for the given resource.

Parameters:
role - The role which is being assigned the permission
action - The identifier for the action
resource - The resource to which the permission applies
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null

denyAll

void denyAll(Role role,
             Resource resource)

Denies the given role to perform any action for the given resource.

Example:
denyAll(role, resource);
deny(anotherRole, "write", resource);

hasAccess(role, "read", resource) - returns false
hasAccess(role, "close", resource) - returns false
hasAccess(role, "write", resource) - returns false
allow(role, "write", resource);
hasAccess(role, "write", resource) - returns true

Parameters:
role - The role which is being assigned the permission
resource - The resource to which the permission applies
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null

removePermission

void removePermission(Role role,
                      java.lang.String action,
                      Resource resource)
Removes any permissions set for the given role, for the given action in the given resource.

Parameters:
role - The role whose permissions are being removed
action - The identifier for the action
resource - The resource from which permissions are removed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null

removeAllPermission

void removeAllPermission(Role role,
                         Resource resource)
Removes the ALL permission set for the given role in the given resource.

Parameters:
role - The role whose permissions are being removed
resource - The resource from which permissions are removed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null

removeAllPermissions

void removeAllPermissions(Role role,
                          Resource resource)
Removes all permissions set for the given role in the given resource.

Parameters:
role - The role whose permissions are being removed
resource - The resource from which permissions are removed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null

hasAccess

boolean hasAccess(Role role,
                  java.lang.String action,
                  Resource resource)
Checks if the given role has the permission to perform the given action for the given resource. If no restrictions have been set for the action-resource pair, then the role is granted access.

Parameters:
role - The Role for which we want to check the permissions
action - The identifier for the action for which we want to check the permissions. This value should be null if we want to check default permissions.
resource - The resource for which the permission is being requested
Returns:
True if role has access to the given action in the given resource
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null

hasAccess

boolean hasAccess(java.util.Set<Role> roles,
                  java.lang.String action,
                  Resource resource)
Checks if the given roles has the permission to perform the given action for the given resource. If no restrictions have been set for the action-resource pair, then access is granted.

Parameters:
roles - A set of roles for which we want to check the permissions
action - The identifier for the action for which we want to check the permissions. This value should be null if we want to check default permissions.
resource - The resource for which the permission is being requested
Returns:
True if role has access to the given action in the given resource
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either role or resource is null
